cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to cross south Florida, emerge into the southeast Gulf, then turn northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Mississippi area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana or Mississippi Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Potential tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) could reach the New Orleans area late Monday night into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 2–4 ft of storm surge along the southeast Louisiana coast, including Lake Pontchartrain, if the center tracks just west of the mouth of the Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall totals of 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts are possible across southeast Louisiana as the system slows near landfall, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and possible river flooding from prolonged rainfall.
